description: New low with high volume indicates genuine breakdown, not a Spring (no shake-out)

breakdown_bar.note: Close near low (21% of range) indicates selling pressure

volume_analysis.interpretation: HIGH VOLUME = GENUINE BREAKDOWN, NOT SPRING

session_validation.note: Session is valid, but volume rejects pattern

not_spring_because: High volume (1.7x session avg) indicates institutional selling
Close near low (21% of range) shows no recovery/absorption
Large Ice distance (10 pips / 0.95%) suggests genuine breakdown, not shake-out
wyckoff_interpretation.expected_behavior: Continued downtrend likely. Spring requires LOW volume (absorption by Composite Operator). High volume = distribution continuing.

test_assertions.rejection_reason: Volume too high (1.71x > 0.7x threshold) - genuine breakdown, not Spring

notes: FR12 NON-NEGOTIABLE volume validation. High volume on breakdown = institutions are selling, not absorbing. Spring MUST have low volume to indicate shake-out. This is a critical distinction - prevents trading false Springs that continue downward.
